Legal_Issue: Whether the Governor in Council fulfilled their duty to act fairly in dismissing Michel Vennat as President and CEO of the BDC
Decision_Outcome: Orders of suspension and dismissal quashed, case remanded to the Governor in Council
Legal_Rule: The duty to act fairly includes giving reasons for dissatisfaction, allowing a meaningful opportunity to respond, conducting a personalized inquiry, and providing sufficient reasoning in the decision
Procedural_Issue: Limited time to respond, lack of personalized inquiry, incorrect standard of proof, inadequate reasoning in decision
Grounds_for_Claim: Breach of procedural fairness in dismissal
Outcome_on_Merits: Governor in Council did not fulfill duty to act fairly
Judicial_Review_Outcome: Application allowed, orders quashed, matter referred back
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Duty to act fairly not fulfilled
Applicant_Challenge: Challenge to fairness of dismissal process
Remedy_Requested: Quashing of dismissal order, referral back for reconsideration
Claimant_Status: Michel Vennat, former President and CEO of BDC
Governing_Rule: Duty of fairness in administrative decision-making
